Description: German President dissolved parliament and announced early electionsGerman President Frank-Walter Steinmeier announced the dissolution of the Bundestag on December 27 and called early elections for February 23, 2025. This decision was made at the request of Chancellor Olaf Scholz, in whom deputies expressed a vote of no confidence.Steinmeier announced his intention to dissolve parliament on December 20, saying that it was no longer possible for the federal government to form a stable parliamentary majority.On December 16, at the vote of confidence in the government of the current Chancellor Olaf Scholz, 394 deputies voted against, 207 for, and 116 abstained. Among those who refused confidence were members of the largest opposition faction - the conservative bloc of the Christian Democratic Union (CDU) and the Christian Social Union (CSU), as well as representatives of the Free Democratic Party (FDP), which left the ruling coalition, the Left parties, as well as populists from the Sarah Wagenknecht Union (SWA) and the Alternative for Germany (AfD). Deputies from the -green- party remaining in the government abstained from voting.

Title: üñº A scandalous journalist may be hiding under the name of serial...
Description: Under the name of the serial informer -Anna Korobkova,- a scandalous journalist may be hidingTogether with linguist Daniil Skorinkin, social anthropologist Alexandra Arkhipova conducted a comparative analysis of the article about -Korobkova- on Wikipedia and the letters she sent to journalists and Arkhipova herself. The history of edits to the article indicates that the text was added by the user -Arkady2023- on the night of October 4-5, which is probably the pseudonym of Ivan Abaturov.Previously, Ivan Abaturov was already involved in a scandal related to denunciations. In August 2022, the director of the Nestor-History publishing house, Sergei Erlikh, said that the police came to the office following a complaint from Abaturov, who accused their book about the Holocaust in Romania of disseminating -false information- about the actions of the USSR in World War II.It is also known that Abaturov is a historian by training. In 2021 he appealed to the Main Military Prosecutor's Office with a proposal to cancel the decision to rehabilitate Mineki. However, the military prosecutor's office said that Mineki is certainly a victim of political repression. Two years later, Alexandra Arkhipova learned that a denunciation had been filed against her from a certain -Anna Korobkova.- The denunciation was sent to the Russian Academy of National Economy and Public Administration under the President (RANEPA), where Arkhipova worked for many years. Since then, -Anna Korobkova- has sent dozens of denunciations and given numerous interviews, posing as a serial informer.

Acting Minister of Housing and Communal Services of the Rostov Region Sergei Orlov in his Telegram channel explained that this was done -in order to prevent an emergency.- -Heat supply to 116 apartment buildings has been reduced during the period of work to replace shut-off valves,- he wrote, and the head of the city, Svetlana Kambulova, wrote separately noted that -the equipment at this boiler house has been in operation since 1965.- Local residents in the comments complain that the boiler house on Zavodskaya Street was turned off 11 times from November 18 to December 23, and the shutdown time sometimes reached 40 hours. At the same time, immediately after repairing the boiler room on Zavodskaya Street, authorities had to stop the operation of the boiler house on Korolev Street, which is why 447 apartment buildings are now left without heating.Recall that in Taganrog for participants of the Northern Military District in 2024 both federal and regional support measures are provided. The regional payment for signing a contract is even higher - 1.6 million rubles. In case of injury, Taganrozh residents receive up to 600 thousand rubles, and in the event of the death of a military relative - 2 million rubles.
